item.title: From Power Up to Main: The Journey of Code Execution
item.description: Assumptions I’m assuming you have some basic knowledge of the compilation process and a little about linkers, you don’t need to be an expert Why Understanding Matters I’m not a big fan of the idea that I can just press the green button and, boom, my code is somehow executing and being debugged on my MCU. I always like to understand what happens before I start using that IDE. In this article, you’ll learn what goes on under the hood, and this knowledge can help you become independent from any IDE but also enable you to add custom frimware maybe your OS…

item.title: Perspective Projection Matrix
item.description: I usually find it hard to take something at face value, while doing some graphics programming, I frequently came across matrices, and for the most part, they were not that complex since I knew some linear algebra beforehand. However, the perspective projection matrix seemed confusing, and I couldn’t wrap my head around it, so I decided to reconstruct it from the ground up Intuition Well, we have a 3D scene, but our screen is 2D.
